entry.title: Mathematicians Transcend Geometric Theory of Motion
entry.content: More than 30 years ago, Andreas Floer changed geometry. Now, two mathematicians have finally figured out how to extend his revolutionary perspective.

entry.title: Why e, the Transcendental Math Constant, Is Just the Best
entry.content: The solution to our puzzle about Euler’s number explains why e pops up in situations that involve optimality.

entry.title: Researchers Defeat Randomness to Create Ideal Code
entry.content: By carefully constructing a multidimensional and well-connected graph, a team of researchers has finally created a long-sought locally testable code that can immediately betray whether it’s been corrupted.

entry.title: What Hot Dogs Can Teach Us About Number Theory
entry.content: The Chinese remainder theorem is an ancient and powerful extension of the simple math of least common multiples.
